text: 1 bunch parsley, chopped (about 1 1/2 cups/75 grams), divided
1 lb polska kielbasa, sliced into thin rounds
3 dried red peppers or 1 teaspoon red-pepper flakes
2 cups crushed tomatoes, I used Tutorrosso
1 medium white or yellow onion, peeled + sliced into 1/4-inch rings
1 tablespoon unrefined or light brown sugar
16 oz 4 cups shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese

2-3 hot chilis, preferably red serranos, seeded, sliced
1 tablespoon light soy sauce ((or soy sauce))
Parmesan, ricotta, and parsley for topping
3/4 cups halved grape or cherry tomatoes
2 (8.8-oz.) pkg. precooked brown rice (such as Uncle Ben's)
3/4 cup pre-seasoned cornbread stuffing mix ((see Cook's Notes in post))
1 bunch coriander, half chopped, half leaves picked
2-4 tablespoons sweet Thai chili sauce, more or less to your taste ((optional))
1 1/2 lbs beef top sirloin, fat trimmed and cut into 1″ cubes
1 Tbsp lemon juice ((1/2 small lemon yields ~1 Tbsp or 15 ml))
4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 2 lbs total)*
2 teaspoons minced peeled fresh ginger, divided
1 large ripe banana ((previously peeled, sliced and frozen // more for a sweeter smoothie))
1 bunch thin asparagus, about 1 1/2 pounds, cut in 1- to 2-inch lengths
5 pounds boneless beef chuck, cut into ½-inch slices
1 package gluten-free pasta (12 ounce bag), cooked according to package instructions
28 oz / 800g canned chickpeas (2 x 14oz/400g cans) (, drained (Note 3))

juice and zest of ½ lemon
shaved Parmigiano Reggiano cheese for topping
10-12 ounces of canned white albacore tuna packed in water, drained
2 Roma tomatoes, each cut into 6 to 8 wedges
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 cups thinly shaved Brussels sprouts (about 8 oz.)
1 large tomato, or about 3 canned plum tomatoes, chopped
1 small Fuji apple, cut into 1/8-in.- thick slices (about 1 cup)
1 teaspoon sriracha sauce, plus more for serving
1/2 cup loosely packed fresh parsley leaves, minced
2 medium scallions, whites and greens separated
4 oz. ground pork ((110g; ground chicken or ground turkey can also be substituted))
3-4 pounds chicken drumsticks ((legs) skin on, 12–15 pieces)
Sweet stir-fry blend (coconut aminos - fish sauce)
3 cups chopped sweet potatoes, fresh or frozen
16 oz 2 large skinless boneless chicken breasts, cut into even bit sized pieces
1/4 teaspoon sea salt, more to taste
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt and black pepper, to taste
2 plum tomatoes (7 ounces; 200g), cored and diced

1 tsp nutmeg powder ((or 1/2 tsp freshly grated))

fresh torn basil and fresh minced parsley
1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breasts, minced
Handful of fresh cilantro leaves, coarsely chopped

3 large carrots, peeled and cut in rounds

4 ounces grated gruyère or Comté cheese
1/2 medium onion, ends trimmed, cut into thin half moons
1/2 cup peeled, seeded and chopped tomato
2 medium potatoes, peeled and chopped into 1/2-inch cubes
2 ounces grated Parmigiano-Reggiano, grated, plus more for serving
1 handful pickled carrot and radishes (see below)
1 teaspoon black sesame seeds for garnish, (optional)
Sea salt to taste ((optional // I didn’t need any))
8 to 10 inner leaves iceberg lettuce, edges trimmed and chilled
4 fresh rounds pita bread, warmed and split just enough to form a pocket
1 package (12.3 ounces) silken firm tofu, cubed
cilantro, mint, limes, pickled ginger, and sesame seeds, for serving
2 whole bunches cilantro, including small stems
1 tablespoon high-heat cooking oil (canola, vegetable, rice)
2 tablespoons coconut oil or extra-virgin olive oil
1/2 cup (120ml) homemade or store-bought tahini sauce (note that tahini and tahini sauce are different products)
1 pound short pasta, such as campanelle, fusilli or farfalle
2 teaspoons Chinese rice wine (or dry sherry (or omit))
2 ripe avocados, peeled and chopped (about 2 cups)
2 tablespoons canola oil or light sesame oil
1/4 cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley, divided
(Optional toppings: shredded cheddar cheese, crushed tortilla chips or strips, thinly-sliced green onions, sour cream, salsa, etc.)
2 tbsp fresh parsley (, finely chopped (or coriander/cilantro))
Vegetable oil, clarified butter, and/or melted butter, for brushing the bread
Sun Basket lemongrass paste (lemongrass - olive oil - fresh garlic - fresh ginger - turmeric)
3 slices white bread, crusts removed, roughly torn
1/4 cup unsalted roasted cashews, coarsely chopped
*Not paleo; omit for a paleo-strict version.
3/4 pound Italian eggplant (about 1 medium eggplant; 350g), sliced into 1/2-inch-thick rounds
1/2 to 1 teaspoon harissa or dried red chile flakes, plus more for serving

Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
4 tablespoons sherry vinegar or cider vinegar
2 leeks, white part only, trimmed and thinly sliced
6 ounces shredded cooked skinless chicken breast, divided
½ small red or white onion, finely chopped
1 cup uncooked brown basmati rice, for serving (rice is optional, I like to cook extra to have on hand for other meals)
2 tablespoons (10g) panko bread crumbs (optional; see note)
½ pineapple, pealed, cored, small diced ( about 3 cups)
.35 ounces instant yeast, such as SAF Instant Yeast (10g; about 2 teaspoons)

Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

5 teaspoons chopped fresh cilantro, divided, plus more for garnish
Two 1-inch-thick slices (for open-faced) or four 1/2-inch-thick slices (for closed sandwiches) white sandwich bread
salt to taste, for salting avocado (I used Vege-Sal, see notes)
2 Tbsp salted creamy peanut ((or almond, cashew, or sunbutter))
1 cup (180g) long grain white rice (, uncooked (Note 3))
1 bunch red radishes, preferably breakfast radishes (daikon are more traditional. I just think red radishes are beautiful.)
1/2 cup cayenne pepper sauce, I used Frank's
1 tablespoon peeled and minced fresh ginger (about a 1-inch piece)
1 1/2 Tbsp sesame oil ((if avoiding oil, leave this out and add a bit more lime, soy sauce, and maple syrup))
16 oz fat free low sodium chicken broth
1 loaf sweet French baguette (thin) or french bread sandwich rolls. Try to get the kind of French bread with a crisp crust and tender light center.
1 pound fresh asparagus, trimmed and coarsely chopped
3 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 jalapeño, diced, seeds removed if desired
2 teaspoons sugar, or more to taste
1 to 3 jalapeño or serrano peppers (to taste), seeded if desired and minced
4 to 6 large boneless, skinless chicken cutlets (buy the cutlets thinly sliced, or buy regular boneless breasts and slice them in half horizontally to make thin pieces)
5 cloves garlic, pressed or minced (about 1 tablespoon)
2 cans (14 ounces each) chickpeas (or 3 cups cooked chickpeas), rinsed and drained
Pinch of kosher salt, or to taste
1.125 ounces Extra Virgin olive oil (32g; about 3 tablespoons)
1 inch fresh ginger, peeled and chopped
2 5 oz cans tuna in water, drained (I used albacore)
14 oz /400g (1 can) coconut milk (preferably full fat but light will be ok)
1 to 2 teaspoons garam masala, to taste
Freshly squeezed juice of 1 lemon, more to taste
fresh sage, sliced into thin ribbons
Soy dipping sauce (such as Soy-Lime Dipping Sauce)
1 cup cottage cheese, rinsed with cold water and drained
10-15 frozen cylindrical rice cakes (optional), or rice noodles, or pasta, or steamed rice
1 pound extra lean (95% lean) ground beef
fresh-ground black pepper and salt to taste for seasoning finished salad
1 small onion (, finely chopped (brown, white, yellow))
optional toppings: thinly-sliced green onions, toasted sesame seeds, extra crushed red pepper flakes
6 garlic cloves, finely grated or minced
3 to 4 medium-size ripe tomatoes, halved through their equators
1 T fresh-squeezed lemon juice, for tossing with avocado (I used my fresh-frozen lemon juice, see notes)
1 cup nut milk of your choice
3 celery ribs (, cut into 1 cm / 2/5" slices)
1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Toppings as desired (sour cream, grated cheddar, chopped red onion, lime wedges, cilantro, sliced avocado, pickled jalapeños, corn nuts, and don't forget Fritos)
1 tablespoon lemon zest, plus 1 tablespoon juice (from 1 lemon)

1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

1/3 cup water ((or sub unsweetened almond milk for creamier consistency))

4 pieces rustic bread ((lightly toasted // gluten-free for GF eaters))
Water or unsweetened almond milk ((to thin))
